So I finally played portal and it was amazing, I only wish I had played this game sooner. First off the concept of the portal gun and portals is awesome, it opens up so many new possibilities and really makes this game stand out. This is paired with some excellent level design and a decent story making this game great. My only real problem with this game is how short it is, in the 6 hours i've played I beat the game twice but hopefully portal 2 will fix that. I give this game 8/10

[b]Single Player Oyun Dünyasına Valve'den son bir dokunuş. 

Valve'in Half-Life ile beraber Single Player oyun dünyasına en büyük armağanı. Bulmaca türünü yeniden tanımlayan Portal, ikinci oyunuyla beraber enfes bir hikayeye de sahip. Eğer bulmaca türüne uzak hissediyorsanız, Portal'ı deneyin ve oyun zevkinizi sorgulayın.

Laboratuvar Robotunun kendine has mizah tarzı ve oyundaki Portal silahı Portal'ı nev-i şahsına münhasır hale getirmeye tek başına yetiyor, hatta artıyor. Portal silahı dışında herhangi bir silah oyunda yer almıyor (İlginç şekilde tam olarak silah dahi denemez çünkü öldürmek ve yaralama için kullanılamıyor) ve Valve öylesine harikulade bir şekilde oyunu dizayn etmiş ki eksikliğini hissetmiyorsunuz.

Aperture Bilim Laboratuvarının test odalarında sakin başlayan maceramız, zorlu bulmacalarıyla hız kesmeden devam ediyor. Her geçen test odasında sürükleyicilik artıyor ve bir noktadan sonra oyun bambaşka bir yapıya evriliyor. Oyun sonu mücadelemizde bu muhteşem oyuna krem şanti oluyor.

2007 yılında çıkmış, 10 yılı çoktan geçirmiş ve halen popülaritesini koruyan bu oyun hakkında; daha fazla konuşmanın manasız, kelimelerin kifayetsiz kalacağını düşünüyor ve incelememi noktalıyorum.[/b]
artık speedrun yapmaktan akıl sağlığımı kaybetcem

There are many kind of games out there. Some are amazing but unheard of by most, games of infamously bad quality, games that merely exist, and so on. Some games however are trailblazers. The kind of game that when it releases leave people talking about it, lingering in the minds of the general public. Portal was once such game. I always heard about it and how great it was and still is, but until recently I never gave it the time of day. Now after finishing the main quest, I wanted to write my review and give my mostly glowing admiration of the game.

The story begins with you, Chell waking up from a hibernated sleep being asked by an AI and told you will be a test experiment in solving puzzles and working your way through "test chambers", areas designed to test the intelligence of the subjects and their new device, The Portal Gun. From there, you solve these puzzles all in the promise of some sweet, sweet cake at the end. While the story is pretty simple overall, it does have its moments and writing is so good (especially in the last hour of the game) that I'm okay with the simplicity of it.

What the real meat of the game though are its "Test Chambers", and this is where the game shines brightly. IT starts out simple enough. You open a portal to reach a spot you can't get to, open a portal to move an object somewhere else, etc. What really astounds me is that despite the simple premise, it really takes advantage of both the concept of using two portals and the momentum and physics used in Half-Life 2 to create an experience that teaches you new things as you go, right up until the end of the game. None of puzzles are tough enough to leave you stuck there for a long time but they're no so simple you can breeze through them. MY only real gripe with them is that puzzles the focus on momentum tend to be a bit wonky. The most notable example for me was after Chamber 19, where you had to use momentum to reach a higher platform. the problem was that you have a tendency to miss your portal if you just look in another direction which made it way harder than it needed to. That and it can cause motion sickness in those susceptible to it like myself.

While I think the game's writing is high-quality and the gameplay is very well done, unfortunately I can't say the same for its presentation. My issue with the graphics aren't really about the image quality or the models, or anything like that. My problem is the choice of aesthetic and color palette. While I understand they wanted to go for a clean, sanitized environment that contrasted with the rust of the real facility, it doesn't exactly lend itself well to environments that captivate or interest me. It makes sense why they're that way, but I don't enjoy it very much overall. The music is fine, mostly doing what HL 2 did and only appearing in specific sections to heighten tension and suspense during key moments, which works effectively.

Something I think also works effectively is its length. The main game can be beaten in about 4-5 hours on a first playthrough. While it is pretty short and replayability is limited by virtue of it being a puzzle game, it does have extra levels you unlock by playing it and bonus challenges to complete for extra side content and achievements if you're into that sort of thing.

In summary, Portal is the kind of game that earned the adoration and praise it received all those years ago. A story that starts simple and gates more complex as it goes on, an environment that makes you feel alone and worthless, strong and entertaining writing, and gameplay that takes a simple concept and uses it in a lot of different ways. I'm not sure if it'll earn a spot in my favorite games of all time list, but I can absolutely see why it would in the eyes and hearts of others. I may have been late to the Portal Party, but I'm still glad I came and got to eat some cake. 

It's an easy recommendation to people who like puzzle games, games that are short in length, or just a game that can entertain you with dialogue.

I have to admit, was intimidated by the prospect of 3D spatial puzzles - I wasn't sure I would be able to solve them and thought they would require hours upon hours of thought. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the puzzles weren't notoriously hard, but were just enough to make you feel good once you solved them. 

The game is delivered in a simple and charming, yet quirky manner. It's oddly endearing... 

I would recommend turning on subtitles, because sometimes what is said is a little difficult to discern.
It's easy to finish in 5 or 6 hours. So give it a try! I would recommend this game to anyone!
Una maravilla de juego, muy corto eso si... Pero aunque no me tomo apenas esfuerzo en terminarlo, lo considero uno de los mas retadores juegos de la categoría de puzzles.

Portal is the first computer game that I finished as an adult, so take that as you want. For me personally, it's an achievement that I'm very proud of. And having played a small share of other games in my life, I think that it is exceptionally good at making you feel smart. The small foreshadowings of things you need to do is wonderful and so much better than games where you keep guessing what you have to do. The only times I cheated was when I didn't finish a level in one sitting, because then you forget about things. Wouldn't recommend. 
All in all, this is great for beginner gamers who like solving puzzles... and probably lots of other people too :D

Tato hra je obsahem Orange Boxu. Ten jsem si koupil kvůli Half-life 2 a jeho dvou epizodám. Portálu jsem velice dlouho nevěnoval pozornost. Po hodně dlouhé době jsem si řekl, že bych ho mohl zkusit, ale upřímně jsem od toho nic nečekal. To byla velká chyba, je to opravdu parádní hra a zkysl jsem u toho ty 3-4 hoďky než jsem to celé dohrál. Vůbec se od toho nešlo odlepit. Ze začátku je to jednoduché a hra nás seznamuje s tím, jak funguje. Ke konci už je to těžší, ale nic neřešitelného. 

Zkusím ještě nějaké bonusové mapy a určitě si koupím i dvojku, zvlášť když je tam koop, který bude určitě velmi zábavný.

Given the tens of thousands of positive reviews for this game, its prominent status as one of the best games of all time, and its substantial impact on the video game industry, there really isn’t much to be said. This game has great mechanics, a fantastic story, and graphics that hold up despite their age (even if they are a bit dated). The only complaints I have are that some of the object collisions can be a little finicky at times, the volume of the audio is a bit inconsistent, and the game is a bit short (although you could argue they solved the last issue by releasing the sequel). However, these minor issues pale in comparison to the rest of the game, and I highly recommend giving this one a try if you haven’t already.

Portal is the quintessential first-person puzzle game. Great mechanics, good graphics, great story with enough dry humor to bake a cake out of. You can get through the single-player story in a matter of 2-3 hours. If you haven't yet, pick this up and get with the program. Science is fun again!

[i]In the recent interview Grey Newell have said that he thinks Valve have problems with creative freedom, their games are so scientific. I should disagree, those games are full of artistic freedom, they just go through so much iterations and pain to bring a real masterpiece to the world. I believe that when Mr. Gray Newell would get older and more experienced, he would realize why Valve is going through so much pain when they are doing things, yet still sticking with this very way, and remain full of passion.[/i]

Played through the game under GNU/Linux with zero issues. Another well made port by Valve.

Started playing Shadow of the Tomb Raider yesterday, loving the HDR colours and the amazing detail and intense action so far.  
Then I thought I would chill out with some Portal after work.  Man, Portal is still as iconic and classic as ever.  DARK humour, amazing villain/best friend, challenging puzzles and fantastic level design all make for the most unlikely masterpiece to find its way into the pantheon.  I really think this is up there with Mario, Space Invaders, Doom, it is that genre breaking and just dang nabbit funny.  I could not stop grinning during the end credits.  Genius.
Highly, highly suggest you get this.  Then grab a friend and do Portal 2.  Then dig out your Xbox 360 and play Still Alive.  Then go play the bonus maps for all of them.  Then hit the workshop.  Mmm.  Cake.

(P.S. I'll be playing Bridge Construction Portal and Portal Stories Mel and The Lab for all the gamers who are still alive)
